page.title: 01LANDSCAPE LOCAL
page.content: {GENERAL SURVEY This area lies in the Middle Marsh of Lincolnshire with the Wolds to the west and the Marsh and Coast to the East.It is very fertile being mainly arable farming but there are beef production, dairy and pig farms. Most of the land drains into the Great Eau, a clear running stream which rises at the foot of the Wolds.Our water supply is provided by the Anglian Water Authority from bores in the Wolds. It is very hard water. Although there is no wooded area the land is pleasantly dotted with deciduous trees. The A157 and B1200 are busy roads especially in the summer as they lead to the seaside and a picnic area is well used at the entrance to Legbourne. Many houses have been built in Legbourne recently. It is a pleasant area to live in with clean air and green vegetation.
